page.title: 11POPULATION AND EMPLOYMENT
page.content: When the last of the Poynton coalmines closed in 1935,the population of the village was under 4,000.Since then the character of the village has changed and the population has increased.In the 1950's there was a rapid increase from under 6,000 to the now estimated 15,000.Poynton is now a commuter village.Unemployment is much lower than the national average and the great majority of people work in Stockport and Manchester.A small percentage work at British Aerospace in Woodford,while an increasing percentage work within the village. Several large housing estates have been built in the last 25years to accomodate the large population increase.Thus from being a village Poynton has become almost a small town
